TextView.android:text: The Me Too movement started in 2006 by Tarana Burke to help spread awareness and help victims of sexual harassment, focusing on women and women of color. Their goal was to put several survivors on the frontlines and have them drive the solutions that would help decrease the cases of sexual harassment and bring global awareness to these issues.

Actresses like Alyssa Milano began to expand the movement once it started, believing that they wanted people to understand the magnitude of women getting sexually harassed. As the Me Too movement gained more attention, it led several states to prohibit the use of nondisclosure agreements in sexual harassment cases. With more recognition, a group of women in Hollywood started a charity and have raised over 24 million dollars since 2018, this has led over 3,900 women to get legal support for their cases.

At one point, majority of the sexual harassment cases have occurred at a young age, 54% of peopleâ€™s average ages are between 18-34. 90% of rape cases are female, and 82% of general sexual harassment cases are women as well. Women of color are three times more likely to be sexually harassed in their workspace compared to their white colleagues.

People started changing their views about the purity of people in power. It started with an accusation of Supreme Court member Brett Kavanaugh sexually harassing Christine Ford. It really opened the eyes of the power that men have in the government over women. Several hearings later, 50 percent of voters supported the fact that men have noticeably more power in the government.

MeToo has become prevalent in many other countries around the world, especially places that are known for their mistreatment of women. Countries such as France, Nigeria, Australia, India, and many more have had thousands of women who have spoken out about their experiences of sexual harassment. In France, Roman Polanski, who has raped many underage girls, sparked a movement within the country. Although their cries for help were muted, the younger generation in France is much stronger and refuses to silence the stories of women being sexually assaulted and catcalled, which was common in the streets of France. In Australia, because they are not protected by freedom of speech, women have had a harder time speaking out about their sexual harassment situations. They are faced with tremendous roadblocks, where the survivors themselves are at risk for getting arrested for speaking out about their struggles. But, a case with Geoffrey Rush gained momentum and allowed Australians to get rid of some old restriction laws. In Nigeria, they started a hashtag #Sex4Grades, where they were forced to have sexual relations with a professor or lecturer for a better grade. Thousands of women have joined together to fight these men and hopefully bring an end to the assault. In India, many women have struggled profusely with sexual harassment cases. The MeToo movement has been one of the biggest revolutions in Indian history, women that came out with their stories where their boyfriend, trusted friends, and sometimes family members have forced themselves on them.
